questions.question: What event makes it possible for Lyddie to go home in chapter 5?

choices.answer: Mrs. Cutler is away.
Triphena needs some sugar.
Lyddie got fired from the tavern.
Mr. Stevens needs help on the farm.

questions.question: How does Lyddie react when she finds out Charlie is going to school and his bosses are kind?

choices.answer: she is offended
she feels disappointed
she feels happy
she feels discouraged

questions.question: When Lyddie arrives at her cabin in chapter 5, what does she discover?

choices.answer: the cabin has been sold
Luke Stevens moved in to the cabin.
There is a black man living there.
Charlie has been living there for some time.

questions.question: How does Triphena feel about Mrs. Cutler?

choices.answer: She thinks the workers are happier when she is not there.
She thinks Mrs. Cutler has earned her time away.
She realizes Mrs. Cutler takes too much time off.
She realizes that the workers don't like Mrs. Cutler.

questions.question: "Pretending courage seemed to manufacture it..."  What does this phrase mean?

choices.answer: Lyddie was pretending to be brave, but was really scared.
Lyddie could not find strength to fake being brave.
Lyddie was faking being brave but then actually felt brave.
Lyddie was scared and had no courage to speak.

questions.question: What is Ezekial doing in the Worthen family cabin?

choices.answer: He was hired by Mr. Stevens to care for the cabin.
He is a runaway slave who is hiding in the cabin.
He bought the cabin without Lyddie knowing it.
Lyddie's mom sent him to take care of the cabin.

questions.question: What characteristic about Ezekial surprises Lyddie the most?

choices.answer: He is educated.
He doesn't know how to start a fire.
He is poor.
He does not have any family.

questions.question: Lyddie gave Ezekial the calf money.  What does this tell us about her character?

choices.answer: She realizes she will never be able to spend it anyway.
She is sympathetic towards Ezekial and wants him to be free.
She is greedy and wants Ezekial to repay it with interest.
She doesn't care much for money.

questions.question: What does Ezekial mean when he says "I hope you find your freedom as well, Miss Lydia."?

choices.answer: Both characters feel they belong to someone else.
Both characters have the freedom to go and work wherever.
Ezekial realizes Lyddie is not a slave.
Ezekial realizes the extent to which Lyddie has helped him.

questions.question: What kind of relationship do Triphena and Lyddie have?

choices.answer: Triphena thinks of Lyddie as her own child.
Triphena gets frustrated by Lyddie's immaturity.
Triphena and Lyddie see each other as equals.
Lyddie feels uncomfortable because Triphena is being a mom.

questions.question: Lyddie gets out of the coach & helps get it out of the mud.  What does this tell us about her?

choices.answer: She often panics in times of need.
She is willing to try new things.
She has the strength to push the carriage out of the mud.
She has common sense & the ability to use it when stressed.

questions.question: What favor does the coachman offer Lyddie once she gets to Lowell?

choices.answer: to let her take care of the horses
to introduce her to his sister who runs a boarding house
to drive her into town where all the factories are
a room in his own house for her to sleep

questions.question: "Six even rows of windows glowered at her through the April drizzle..." What is the tone?

choices.answer: relaxed
comfortable
depressing
gloomy

questions.question: "Six even rows of windows seemed to glower at her.." What is a synonym for the word "glower?"

choices.answer: smile
ignore
scowl
laugh

questions.question: "Their mother, really, who shucked them off like corn husks..." What is the meaning of shucked?

choices.answer: kept them
questioned them
threw them away
held them

questions.question: "The passengers were obliged to alight..."  What does alight mean?

choices.answer: get out
get on
shift in their seats
to enter into
